sentence.Network_en: A stew without an onion is like a dance without a tambourine.
sentence.Network_cn: 烧菜没有洋葱就像跳舞没有手鼓.

sentence.Network_en: Hey! Mr. Tambourine Man, play a song for me.
sentence.Network_cn: 嘿! 鼓手坦布尔曼先生,请为我演唱一曲.

sentence.Network_en: Begin the music , strike the tambourine , play the melodious harp and lyre.
sentence.Network_cn: 唱起诗歌,打手鼓, 弹美琴与瑟.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from French tambourin (see tambourin)

entry.def: A tambourine is a musical instrument which you shake or hit with your hand. It consists of a drum skin on a circular frame with pairs of small round pieces of metal all around the edge.

means.word_mean: 1. a shallow drum with a single drumhead and with metallic disks in the sides
